content: I have a great sense of humor, or at least I think I do. lol I think she is funny, I laugh at her when I watch her on the Larry David show. I laughed at her jokes just as I laughed when I watched the Reps telling their jokes or McCain at that dinner. The only trouble is I think both left and right and all comics are out of line disrespecting the President and his office. You can question without disrespect. It was and is awful how they disrespect Bush. Sure he made mistakes but like Obama has not? Or Clinton, Or Carter? Come on! It takes two to tango and both sides have and will mess up. I think the media is out of line for not being harder on Obama and questioning him more. I don't mind them praising him for the good stuff, but what they let Obama get away they never would have sat silent with Bush. We have moved on to the next President and the Dems still want to go back and drag Bush out in the street. It is fine if you want to say, we are in now and we change the rules, but you don't go back and try and put a guy or his staff in jail for keeping the country safe for 7 years. Shoot, they want to throw Bush in jail for getting a little water on terrorist who tried to hurt us, and Obama doesn't even ask questions, he just shoots the three pirates in the head. Where is the outrage on that?

content: I have a great sense of humor, or at least I think I do. lol I think she is funny, I laugh at her when I watch her on the Larry David show. I laughed at her jokes just as I laughed when I watched the Reps telling their jokes or McCain at that dinner. The only trouble is I think both left and right and all comics are out of line disrespecting the President and his office. You can question without disrespect. It was and is awful how they disrespect Bush. Sure he made mistakes but like Obama has not? Or Clinton, Or Carter? Come on! It takes two to tango and both sides have and will mess up. I think the media is out of line for not being harder on Obama and questioning him more. I don't mind them praising him for the good stuff, but what they let Obama get away they never would have sat silent with Bush. We have moved on to the next President and the Dems still want to go back and drag Bush out in the street. It is fine if you want to say, we are in now and we change the rules, but you don't go back and try and put a guy or his staff in jail for keeping the country safe for 7 years. Shoot, they want to throw Bush in jail for getting a little water on terrorist who tried to hurt us, and Obama doesn't even ask questions, he just shoots the three pirates in the head. Where is the outrage on that?

content: I have a great sense of humor, or at least I think I do. lol I think she is funny, I laugh at her when I watch her on the Larry David show. I laughed at her jokes just as I laughed when I watched the Reps telling their jokes or McCain at that dinner. The only trouble is I think both left and right and all comics are out of line disrespecting the President and his office. You can question without disrespect. It was and is awful how they disrespect Bush. Sure he made mistakes but like Obama has not? Or Clinton, Or Carter? Come on! It takes two to tango and both sides have and will mess up. I think the media is out of line for not being harder on Obama and questioning him more. I don't mind them praising him for the good stuff, but what they let Obama get away they never would have sat silent with Bush. We have moved on to the next President and the Dems still want to go back and drag Bush out in the street. It is fine if you want to say, we are in now and we change the rules, but you don't go back and try and put a guy or his staff in jail for keeping the country safe for 7 years. Shoot, they want to throw Bush in jail for getting a little water on terrorist who tried to hurt us, and Obama doesn't even ask questions, he just shoots the three pirates in the head. Where is the outrage on that?

It was and is awful how they disrespect Bush. Sure he made mistakes but like Obama has not? Or Clinton, Or Carter? Come on! It takes two to tango and both sides have and will mess up. I think the media is out of line for not being harder on Obama and questioning him more. I don't mind them praising him for the good stuff, but what they let Obama get away they never would have sat silent with Bush. We have moved on to the next President and the Dems still want to go back and drag Bush out in the street. It is fine if you want to say, we are in now and we change the rules, but you don't go back and try and put a guy or his staff in jail for keeping the country safe for 7 years. Shoot, they want to throw Bush in jail for getting a little water on terrorist who tried to hurt us, and Obama doesn't even ask questions, he just shoots the three pirates in the head. Where is the outrage on that?

content: I have a great sense of humor, or at least I think I do. lol I think she is funny, I laugh at her when I watch her on the Larry David show. I laughed at her jokes just as I laughed when I watched the Reps telling their jokes or McCain at that dinner. The only trouble is I think both left and right and all comics are out of line disrespecting the President and his office. You can question without disrespect. It was and is awful how they disrespect Bush. Sure he made mistakes but like Obama has not? Or Clinton, Or Carter? Come on! It takes two to tango and both sides have and will mess up. I think the media is out of line for not being harder on Obama and questioning him more. I don't mind them praising him for the good stuff, but what they let Obama get away they never would have sat silent with Bush. We have moved on to the next President and the Dems still want to go back and drag Bush out in the street. It is fine if you want to say, we are in now and we change the rules, but you don't go back and try and put a guy or his staff in jail for keeping the country safe for 7 years. Shoot, they want to throw Bush in jail for getting a little water on terrorist who tried to hurt us, and Obama doesn't even ask questions, he just shoots the three pirates in the head. Where is the outrage on that?

content: I have a great sense of humor, or at least I think I do. lol I think she is funny, I laugh at her when I watch her on the Larry David show. I laughed at her jokes just as I laughed when I watched the Reps telling their jokes or McCain at that dinner. The only trouble is I think both left and right and all comics are out of line disrespecting the President and his office. You can question without disrespect. It was and is awful how they disrespect Bush. Sure he made mistakes but like Obama has not? Or Clinton, Or Carter? Come on! It takes two to tango and both sides have and will mess up. I think the media is out of line for not being harder on Obama and questioning him more. I don't mind them praising him for the good stuff, but what they let Obama get away they never would have sat silent with Bush. We have moved on to the next President and the Dems still want to go back and drag Bush out in the street. It is fine if you want to say, we are in now and we change the rules, but you don't go back and try and put a guy or his staff in jail for keeping the country safe for 7 years. Shoot, they want to throw Bush in jail for getting a little water on terrorist who tried to hurt us, and Obama doesn't even ask questions, he just shoots the three pirates in the head. Where is the outrage on that?

content: She should have come up with another tie-in other than 9-11. Bad taste, but that is not uncommon at that function. I could care less if she joked about Limbaugh; he threw his hat/mouth in the ring and has to take his lumps too. But she did get what he said wrong. Limbaugh said he hoped Presodent obama fails in his drive to control private industry. He said nothing about the country, the troops, or anything else. His point was against socialism.
